TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BaseDataListComponentEditor extends System.Windows.Forms.Design.WindowsFormsComponentEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a component editor base class for Web server controls that are derived from the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A component editor provides a user interface for editing the properties of a control. Component editors are invoked from control designers by using the **Property Builder** menu item from the context menu on the control. Component editors that are derived from the BaseDataListComponentEditor class are invoked from designers derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner> class, and are used to edit the properties of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class. For examples of such controls, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListComponentEditor.EditComponent%2A> method displays a component editor for the associated control, if one can be created. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListComponentEditor.GetInitialComponentEditorPageIndex%2A> method returns the index of the initial page to be displayed in the component editor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 initialPage) cil managed

Docs.param: The index in the array of page control types, of the initial page to display.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A designer that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner> class creates a component editor that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListComponentEditor> class, when the user selects **Property Builder** from the context menu within the designer.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool EditComponent (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, object obj, System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window parent);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool EditComponent(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, object obj, class System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window parent) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that can be used to gain additional context information.
An <xref:System.Object> implementing the , which represents the component to edit.
The that represents the parent window.
Docs.summary: Edits the specified component by using the specified context descriptor and parent window.
Docs.returns: the component was successfully edited; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListComponentEditor.EditComponent%2A> method gets a <xref:System.Type> array of page control types by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.WindowsFormsComponentEditor.GetComponentEditorPages%2A> method. It creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm> object, and then calls its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.ShowForm%2A> method to display the component editor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance int32 GetInitialComponentEditorPageIndex() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the initial page to display in the component editor.
Docs.returns: The index of the initial page in the array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The initial page is specified when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListComponentEditor> object is created.
